description: Crispy rice and stir-fried veggies are seasoned up with sake-soy sauce and served with smoky tofu bacon to make this scrumptious vegan Japanese fried rice!
name: Hibachi Style Japanese Fried Rice
recipeIngredient: 1/2 lb. extra firm tofu, (drained, pressed and cut into 1/2 inch cubes)
3 scallions, (white and green parts separated, chopped)
4 cups leftover rice, (chilled (jasmine rice works great)
2 tsp. sesame seeds, (plus extra for serving)

recipeInstructions.text: Stir soy sauce, vinegar, maple syrup and liquid smoke together in a small bowl. Add tofu and toss to coat. Allow to marinate for about 30 minutes, tossing occasionally to recoat.
Preheat oven to 400Â° and line a baking sheet with parchment. Arrange tofu cubes on baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven.

Coat the bottom of a large skillet lightly with margarine or oil and place over medium-high heat. Add tofu cubes and cook about 5 minutes, flipping once to get some crisping on multiple sides. Remove from skillet and transfer to a plate. Leave the skillet on the stove.
